intro: Kalonymus macroptera, commonly known as the large-leaved kalonymus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by orange-red berries. Kalonymus macroptera is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
